H0.text: Rings are the structures that distinguish Saturn, with spokes that appear seasonally and an origin that is as yet unknown.

H1.text: Moons are the structures whose spokes, which distinguish Saturn, appear seasonally, with an origin as yet unknown.

H2.text: Craters are the structures whose spokes distinguish Saturn and appear seasonally, with an origin as yet unknown.

H3.text: Satellites are the structures that distinguish Saturn whose spokes appear seasonally, with an origin as yet unknown.

A4.text: The spokes appear to be a seasonal phenomenon, disappearing in the Saturnian midwinter and midsummer and reappearing as Saturn comes closer to equinox.

A5.text: The precise mechanism generating the spokes is still unknown.
